column5: COVID shutdowns have exposed one of America’s most basic class divides–that between those who can work from home and those who can’t. For many the shutdowns have been a disaster; for others a convenience. I’m going to repost a chart on a survey that was part of Steve’s most recent The Geek In Pictures. Who thought 2020 was a terrific year? Urbanites with graduate degrees and high incomes:  This comment is I think spot on: Affluent professionals think obeying covid rules is what makes someone a “good person.” In reality the ability to stay home is mostly a marker of class status. A lot of people are addicted to covid panic because lockdowns let them equate their income level with personal virtue. — alex g (@galexybrane) January 22 2021
